Fast Facts About Pits
From the Pits Wiki

In case you're in a rush, this article is for you! A team of a variety(one) of experts(disputable) have a treasure trove of important information about pits you should know:

  • There's at least 100 pits in the world, a majority of which come from countries like Iceland, Vanuatu, Africa, and others like it.
  • The largest pit in the world is the one in my forever-broken heart.
  • Some cities, such as Pittsburgh (USA), are located entirely in giant crater-sized pits. The city's interesting design currently extends down up to 2.5 km (5.65 mi) below surface level, which makes it invisible from space and on Google Maps.
  • The comet that killed the dinosaurs created a smoldering pit that continues to be on fire to this day. It alone generates 72% of the tourism revenue of Mexico.
  • Many pits are filled with something other than sediment. These filler materials can be anything from metals to liquids to dark, endless, space-consuming voids. One of the most famous pits is the Atlantic Ocean, which is filled mostly with salinated water and some hostile lifeforms.
  • The number of naturally-dug pits is drastically decreasing due to rapid urbanization. Scientists are currently researching solutions to this drastic problem—dubbed "The Great Flattening"—such as placing potholes on highways and sinkholes in population-dense areas so that "pits and humans can co-exist in harmony".
  • To grow a pit in dirt, sand, or another man-made product, dig a hole and water it hourly. After several million years, the ground will erode.
  • The Hypixel Pit (2018) is the latest pit to be created. According to its creators, no pits of any kind will ever be created in the future.
